author: Akshay jadhav

text:
try this
#Getting YouTube data
#Installing packages
install.packages("vosonSML")
library(vosonSML)

# Google developer API key
# https://console.developers.google.com/
#https://console.developers.google.com/apis/library/youtube.googleapis.com?q=youtube&id=125bab65-cfb6-4f25-9826-4dcc309bc508
# Check if your API was activated
apikey <- "write here your YouTube Data API (v3) key"

# Collect data using YouTube video IDs
videoIDs <- c('3gJngOCyrZg', 'otoXeVPhT7Q')

# Authenticate, Collect
ytdata <- Authenticate("youtube", apiKey = apikey) %>% Collect(videoIDs = videoIDs)

#Write csv file in the right path in your computer
write.csv(ytdata, file = "~Desktop/yt.csv", row.names = FALSE)Ôªø

library('vosonSML')

# Collect data using YouTube video IDs

author: Bharatendra Rai

Read the last line saying Social Media Lab is not availableÔªø
author: Akshay Verma

text: When I called library(SocialMediaLab) it showed that Social Media Lab is not a packageÔªø
author: Akshay Verma

text:
Run this code Akshay.

install.packages("httr")
if(!"devtools" %in% installed.packages()) install.packages("devtools")
require(devtools)
#we have to install an earlier version of the 'httr' package
#due to incompatibility problems with the 'twitteR' package
devtools::install_version("httr",version="0.6.0",repos="http://cran.us.r-project.org")
devtools::install_github("voson-lab/SocialMediaLab/SocialMediaLab")
require(SocialMediaLab)
if(!"magrittr" %in% installed.packages())install.packages("magrittr")
require(magrittr)

It will install SocialMediaLab from github. The CRAN repository doesn't hold the package for R 3.4.3 versions and higher I guess.Ôªø
author: Arindam Ray

text:
You can run following to install the package:
devtools::install_github("vosonlab/SocialMediaLab/SocialMediaLab")Ôªø

author: Bharatendra Rai

text:
I tried the video id : video<- c('3gJngOCyrZg&t=1s','0xsM0MbRPGE&t=3s')
Then I ran this line:  ytdata<- CollectDataYoutube(video,key,writeToFile = FALSE)
as soon as I am running this line this error is showing :   ......Error in CollectDataYoutube(video, key, writeToFile = FALSE) :

author: DEBASMITA DEY

text:
If you remove everything after and including "&", it should work fine. Your line for those two videos should look as given below:
video <- c("3gJngOCyrZg","0xsM0MbRPGE")Ôªø
